body.p: It is with mutchmuch pleasure that I take my pen in hand to inform you that I am well and that my leg is mending verryvery fast I left Washington on the 2nd on the 6 1/2 O clock train but It was the rongwrong train and I had to get of at Haver de gras and stay all night on the Boat or els go on to Wilmington and so I got of and stayed on the boat and as good luck would have it I met 3 men on the boat that I knowedknew and they maid me verryvery comfortable that night and then I left the next morning and got home in the evening and I gave Mother a verryvery agreeable Supprise I was verry tired the next day but I feel well now. I think that I will soon get well hear for I have everything that I want we have a splendid garden and we have a good many cherries in fact every thing, the nice grain fields around the house and every thing looks so well. I have had a good many of my young friends to see me. I have got your picture and I am a going to have it fraimedframed the first time I get whearwhere I can have it don. I expect to go on a visit up to my GranFathersGrandfather's in about 4 weeks and I think that I will have a nice time up thearthere. I only wish that you werwere hear I am sure that you would enjoy it for it is so nice or it appears so to me [w]ho has been penndpenned up in the Hospital for 10 months. My Father and Mother are well and send their respects to you for Mother says whoeve[r] did me a faivorfavor or was a friend to me was one to her and you have bin a friend in neadneed and that is a friend indeadindeed. I expect that you still visit the Hospital if so give my respects to the boys I have nothing more to write at present so I will have to close hoping verryvery soon to hear from you so good by and God bless you from your affectionetaffectionate friend

postscript.p: care of James McPauley P.S. pleasplease excuesexcuse this bad writing as well as spelling I have just herd of the fall of Vicksburg and I am g[l]ad of it and Simple Mead has drove the rebbelsrebels out of Pennsylvania.
